title: Laila Shariff

    Laila Shariff

title: Laila Shariff
text:
Biography
Laila is a senior undergraduate studying Psychology and Cognitive Science, with a minor in Visual Design. She is passionate about understanding how people think, learn, and interact with the world around them - especially through the lens of inclusive design and storytelling. Outside of academics, Laila enjoys film photography, crocheting, and a good iced matcha latte!

title: Laila Shariff
text:
Education
Case Western Reserve University | Cleveland, OH, USA BA | 2026 - Psychology - Cognitive Science

title: Nithya Pandari
text:
Home
    People
    Research Assistants
    Nithya Pandari

title: Nithya Pandari
text:
Biography
Nithya Pandari’s research interests span social cognition, language development, and adolescent mental health. She is particularly drawn to exploring how cognitive and communicative processes are shaped by early experiences, social media exposure, and bilingualism.
Nithya is pursuing her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology and Cognitive Science at Case Western Reserve University, where she is also on the pre-medical track. She is now an undergraduate research assistant in the Communication and Speech Emergence Laboratory.
Nithya has clinical experience through her role as a Patient Care Nurse Assistant at the Cleveland Clinic and volunteer work in acute care and pediatric settings. Passionate about working with children, she hopes to integrate research, clinical care, and community outreach in her future career. Outside of the lab, she is an active dancer with Spartan Bhangra, enjoys organizing large-scale cultural events, and loves spending time with family and friends.

title: Nithya Pandari
text:
Education
Case Western Reserve University | Cleveland, OH, USA BA | 2026 - Psychology - Cognitive Science

title: Cassandra López, MA, CCC-SLP
text:
Home
    People

    Cassandra López, MA, CCC-SLP

title: Cassandra López, MA, CCC-SLP
text:
Biography
Cassandra López, M.A., CCC-SLP (she/her/ella) is a PhD student in Communication Sciences at Case Western Reserve University and trained bilingual speech-language pathologist. Cassandra’s research interests include engaging with communities to examine the cultural and linguistic factors that impact the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of various communication disorders among bilingual populations. Her current research aims to advance the accessibility of Communication Sciences and Disorders (CSD) Spanish resources for clinicians and families by leveraging artificial intelligence. Her primary mentor is Dr. Lauren Calandruccio in the Speech and Auditory Research (SpAR) Lab, and is completing a lab rotation with Dr. Long in the Summer and Fall of 2025.
Cassandra has clinical experience working across pediatric and adult settings providing Spanish-English bilingual therapy in the areas of speech, language, social communication, dysphagia, and aphasia.
Cassandra is the founder of the CSD Bilingüe Suite, a student-led organization dedicated to empowering students through mentorship and experiential learning. Their mission is to foster a welcoming and respectful environment within the field of CSD to train the next generation of bilingual clinicians. Outside of academics, Cassandra enjoys crafting, watching shows, and spending time with friends.

title: Cassandra López, MA, CCC-SLP
text:
